p: Sharma and Shukla reported that ginger juice can lower blood glucose concentration in normal fasting animals and in alloxan diabetic animals [ 171]. The mechanism of lowering the glucose effect was explained because it can increase the viscosity of gastrointestinal contents, slow gastric emptying and also acts as a barrier to diffusion. Other studies also demonstrated that folk medicinal plant ginger can control tissue glycogen content in diabetic rats by improving the peripheral utilization of glucose and repairing the impaired liver [ 172].
